TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit XmlSerializerFormatAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class XmlSerializerFormatAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class XmlSerializerFormatAttribute sealed : Attribute

Docs.summary: Instructs the Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) infrastructure to use the instead of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This attribute is similar to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.DataContractFormatAttribute> attribute. Both attributes can be applied to a method, class, or interface.
For more information about the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer>, see [Using the XmlSerializer Class](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/using-the-xmlserializer-class.md).
A method can have either of the two attributes applied, but not both. Any operation that has neither applied uses the attribute applied to the containing class. If the containing class does not have either attribute applied, the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer> is used.
Applying the attribute also causes a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.XmlSerializerOperationBehavior> to be created at runtime. The behavior allows customization at runtime of the serializer behavior.
## Examples The following example applies the <xref:System.ServiceModel.XmlSerializerFormatAttribute> to an interface.
[!code-csharp[XmlSerializerFormatAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/xmlserializerformatattribute/cs/xmlserializerformat_example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlSerializerFormatAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/xmlserializerformatattribute/vb/xmlserializerformat_example.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.XmlSerializerFormatAttribute.Style%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.XmlSerializerFormatAttribute.Use%2A> properties affect how messages are formatted.
## Examples For a complete example, see [Setting the Use and Style Properties](~/docs/framework/wcf/samples/setting-the-use-and-style-properties.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates that the should be used for reading and writing faults.
Docs.value: if the should be used for reading and writing faults; if the should be used. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default formatter for fault serialization is the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer>. To use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer>, set this property to `true`. Starting in .NET 4 the serializer set by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.XmlSerializerFormatAttribute.SupportFaults%2A> property will be used even if a custom behavior is set on the contract to which the <xref:System.ServiceModel.XmlSerializerFormatAttribute> is applied.

## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.XmlSerializerFormatAttribute.Style%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.XmlSerializerFormatAttribute.Use%2A> properties affect how messages are formatted.
## Examples For a complete example, see [Setting the Use and Style Properties](~/docs/framework/wcf/samples/setting-the-use-and-style-properties.md).
